intro: Aegiphila cuspidata f. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered mountain mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
